focus_skills: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
One-variable data: distributions and measures of center and spread
Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units

questions.question: If <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>21</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Add 9 to both sides of the equation: <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math>. Divide both sides by 5: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Isolate the variable term first by performing inverse operations for addition or subtraction, then handle multiplication or division.

questions.question: A bag contains 6 red marbles, 4 blue marbles, and 10 green marbles. If one marble is selected at random from the bag, what is the probability that it is blue?
questions.explanation: Calculate the total number of marbles: <math><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. The number of blue marbles is 4. The probability is <math><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>20</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Probability is the ratio of favorable outcomes to the total number of possible outcomes.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='300' viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrowhead' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='7' refX='0' refY='3.5' orient='auto'><polygon points='0 0, 10 3.5, 0 7' fill='black'/></marker></defs><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='280' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrowhead)' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrowhead)' /><line x1='30' y1='70' x2='230' y2='270' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='50' cy='90' r='4' fill='black' /><text x='280' y='240' font-family='Times New Roman' font-style='italic' font-size='14'>x</text><text x='35' y='20' font-family='Times New Roman' font-style='italic' font-size='14'>y</text><text x='25' y='95' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' text-anchor='end'>80</text><text x='35' y='265' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>0</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A graph of a linear function in the xy-plane. The x-axis is horizontal and the y-axis is vertical, intersecting at the origin (0,0). A blue line with a negative slope is plotted. It intersects the y-axis at a marked point labeled 80. The line extends from the top-left quadrant down towards the bottom-right.
questions.question: The graph of the linear function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is shown. What is the <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept of the graph of <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: The <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept is the point where the graph crosses the <math><mi>y</mi></math>-axis. This occurs when <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Looking at the graph, the line crosses the vertical <math><mi>y</mi></math>-axis at the value labeled 80. Therefore, the coordinates of the <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept are <math><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>)</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find the y-intercept from a graph, look for the point where the line touches or crosses the vertical axis.

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 12 centimeters and a width of 5 centimeters. What is the area, in square centimeters, of the rectangle?
questions.explanation: The area of a rectangle is calculated as <math><mi>length</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>width</mi></math>. Therefore, <math><mn>12</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Memorize basic geometric formulas: Area of a rectangle = l * w.

questions.skill: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
questions.question:
The system of equations below is defined as follows:
2x-y=4
x+2y=7
What is the value of x in the solution (x,y) to the system?
questions.explanation: From the first equation, isolate <math><mi>y</mi></math>: <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Substitute this into the second equation: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>. Simplify: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>, so <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math>, which gives <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For systems of equations, substitution is often efficient when one variable is easily isolated.

questions.question: Which of the following expressions is equivalent to <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Distribute the terms: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></math> and <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Combine like terms: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Be careful with signs when distributing negative numbers into parentheses.

questions.skill: One-variable data: distributions and measures of center and spread
questions.question: The data set <math><mi>S</mi></math> consists of the numbers <math><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. If a new number, <math><mn>45</mn></math>, is added to the set to create a new data set <math><mi>T</mi></math>, what is the difference between the mean of set <math><mi>T</mi></math> and the mean of set <math><mi>S</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Mean of S: <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>75</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math>. Mean of T: <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>75</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>45</mn></mrow><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>120</mn><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. The difference is <math><mn>20</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Adding an outlier much larger than the current mean will always increase the mean.

questions.question: A line in the <math><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane passes through the points <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></math> and <math><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>17</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What is the slope of this line?
questions.explanation: The formula for slope <math><mi>m</mi></math> is <math><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>. Calculating: <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>12</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Slope represents the 'rise over run', or the change in y divided by the change in x.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='200' viewBox='0 0 300 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><polygon points='50,150 230,150 230,75' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><polyline points='220,150 220,140 230,140' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1.5' /><path d='M 75 150 A 25 25 0 0 1 73 140' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' /><text x='235' y='75' font-family='serif' font-size='16'>B</text><text x='35' y='155' font-family='serif' font-size='16'>A</text><text x='235' y='160' font-family='serif' font-size='16'>C</text><text x='140' y='170' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>12</text><text x='130' y='105' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>13</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A right-angled triangle ABC with the right angle at vertex C (bottom-right). The horizontal leg AC is labeled 12. The hypotenuse AB is labeled 13. Leg AC is visibly longer than the vertical leg BC.
questions.question: In the right triangle shown, the length of side <math><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi></math> is 12 and the length of the hypotenuse <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math> is 13. What is the value of <math><mi>tan</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation:
To find tan(A), we need the length of the opposite side (BC) and the adjacent side (AC).
1. Use the Pythagorean theorem to find BC: AC2+BC2=AB2.
2. Substitute known values: 122+BC2=132.
3. Solve for BC: 144+BC2=169, so BC2=25, which means BC=5.
4. Calculate the tangent: tan(A)=oppositeadjacent=BCAC=512.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember SOH CAH TOA. Tangent is Opposite over Adjacent.

questions.question: The population of a bacterial colony doubles every 3 hours. If the initial population is 500 bacteria, which equation models the population, <math><mi>P</mi></math>, after <math><mi>t</mi></math> hours?
questions.explanation: The general form for exponential growth is <math><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>Initial</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>Rate</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mi>period</mi></mfrac></msup></math>. Here, initial population is 500, the rate is 2 (doubles), and the period is 3 hours. Thus, <math><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></msup></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Check the exponent: when t = 3, the exponent should be 1, doubling the initial value.

questions.question: The equation <math><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo></math> has no solution for <math><mi>x</mi></math>. What is the value of the constant <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Distribute the 3 on the right side: <math><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></math>. For a linear equation to have no solution, the coefficients of <math><mi>x</mi></math> must be equal, but the constant terms must be different. Therefore, <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Checking the constants: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>≠</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, so <math><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>≠</mo><mn>9</mn></math>, which is true.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Equations of the form ax + b = cx + d have no solution if a = c and b ≠ d.

questions.question: What is the sum of the solutions to the equation <math><msqrt><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Square both sides: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Expand: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Rearrange to <math><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Factor: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Potential solutions are <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Check for extraneous roots: for <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, LHS is <math><msqrt><mn>1</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, RHS is <math><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> (not equal). For <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, LHS is <math><msqrt><mn>16</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>, RHS is 4 (valid). The only solution is <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Thus, the sum of the solutions is 2.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Always plug solutions back into radical equations to check for extraneous roots.

questions.question: A survey asked 200 adults whether they prefer coffee or tea. The results showed that 120 adults prefer coffee, and of those, 80 are morning people. Of the adults who prefer tea, 30 are morning people. If an adult is selected at random from those who are morning people, what is the probability that this adult prefers tea?
questions.explanation: Total morning people = (Morning Coffee Drinkers) + (Morning Tea Drinkers). We know 80 coffee drinkers are morning people. We know 30 tea drinkers are morning people. Total morning people = <math><mn>80</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>110</mn></math>. The question asks for probability of preferring tea GIVEN they are a morning person. <math><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>Tea</mi><mo>|</mo><mi>Morning</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>30</mn><mn>110</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>11</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For conditional probability, restrict your denominator to the 'given' group.

questions.question: The equation of a circle in the <math><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane is <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. What is the radius of the circle?
questions.explanation: Complete the square for both <math><mi>x</mi></math> and <math><mi>y</mi></math>. For <math><mi>x</mi></math>: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. For <math><mi>y</mi></math>: <math><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></math>. Add constants to the right side: <math><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>. The equation becomes <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>. The radius squared is 25, so the radius is 5.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find the center and radius from general form, complete the square for x and y terms.

questions.question:
How many distinct real solutions does the following system of equations have?
y=x2+3x+5
y=2x+1
questions.explanation: Set the equations equal: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. Simplify to <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Calculate the discriminant <math><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></math>: <math><msup><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>15</mn></math>. Since the discriminant is negative, there are no real solutions.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use the discriminant (b^2 - 4ac) to determine the number of real solutions for a quadratic equation.

questions.question: A cargo truck carries boxes of type A and boxes of type B. Type A boxes weigh 40 pounds each, and Type B boxes weigh 65 pounds each. The truck can carry a maximum weight of 2,000 pounds and a maximum of 40 boxes. Let <math><mi>a</mi></math> be the number of Type A boxes and <math><mi>b</mi></math> be the number of Type B boxes. Which system of inequalities represents this situation?
questions.explanation: The constraint on the number of boxes is <math><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>40</mn></math>. The constraint on weight is <math><mn>40</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>65</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2000</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Translate constraints like 'maximum' to 'less than or equal to' inequalities.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='50' y1='50' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='5,5' /><circle cx='100' cy='83' r='4' fill='blue' /><circle cx='150' cy='116' r='4' fill='blue' /><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='4' fill='blue' /><circle cx='250' cy='183' r='4' fill='blue' /><circle cx='300' cy='216' r='4' fill='blue' /><text x='180' y='290' font-family='Arial' font-size='14'>Time (hours)</text><text x='15' y='150' transform='rotate(-90 15,150)' font-family='Arial' font-size='14'>Distance (miles)</text><text x='35' y='265' font-family='Arial' font-size='12'>0</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with 5 points forming a strong linear negative trend representing distance remaining decreasing over time.
questions.question: A car travels toward a destination at a constant speed. The scatterplot shows the distance remaining, <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>d</mi></math>, in miles, after <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>t</mi></math> hours. If the data is modeled by the equation <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>300</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>60</mn><mi>t</mi></math>, what is the best interpretation of the number 60 in this context?

options.A: The initial distance from the destination.
options.B: The total time to reach the destination.
options.C: The speed of the car in miles per hour.

questions.explanation: The equation is linear in the form <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>. The slope is -60. Since <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>d</mi></math> is distance remaining, a decrease of 60 miles per hour implies the car is traveling at 60 mph.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In linear models <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>a</mi></math> represents the rate of change.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='220' viewBox='0 0 300 220' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><polygon points='150,30 50,190 250,190' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='100' y1='110' x2='200' y2='110' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='150' y='20' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>C</text><text x='40' y='200' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='end'>A</text><text x='260' y='200' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='start'>B</text><text x='90' y='115' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='end'>D</text><text x='210' y='115' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='start'>E</text><text x='150' y='105' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>x</text><text x='150' y='210' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>20</text><text x='85' y='70' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' text-anchor='end'>5</text><text x='65' y='150' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' text-anchor='end'>5</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Triangle ABC with base AB at the bottom. A line segment DE connects side AC to side BC, parallel to the base. D is the midpoint of AC, and E is the midpoint of BC. The length of the base AB is 20, the segment CD is 5, and DA is 5. The length of DE is labeled x.
questions.question: In the figure shown, segment <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>D</mi><mi>E</mi></math> is parallel to base <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math>. If <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>C</mi><mi>D</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>D</mi><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, and <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>, what is the length of <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>D</mi><mi>E</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Triangle <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>C</mi><mi>D</mi><mi>E</mi></math> is similar to Triangle <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math>. The ratio of similarity corresponds to the ratio of side lengths: <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mfrac><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>. Since <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi><mi>D</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>D</mi><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>, the ratio is <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>10</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. Therefore, <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>D</mi><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For similar triangles, compare corresponding sides. Ensure you use the total side length of the larger triangle.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. The function <math><mi>g</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Which of the following is the minimum value of <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is a parabola with vertex at <math><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, so its minimum value is 4. <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math> represents a horizontal shift of <math><mi>f</mi></math> to the left by 3 units. A horizontal shift does not affect the vertical position of the vertex. Therefore, the minimum value remains 4.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Transformations like f(x+k) shift the graph horizontally and do not change the range (y-values) of the function.

questions.question: A runner completes a race at an average speed of 8 meters per second. If the runner had run at an average speed of 10 meters per second, the race would have been completed 5 seconds faster. What is the distance, in meters, of the race?
questions.explanation: Let <math><mi>d</mi></math> be the distance. Time at 8 m/s is <math><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mn>8</mn></mfrac></math>. Time at 10 m/s is <math><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mn>10</mn></mfrac></math>. The difference in time is 5 seconds: <math><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mn>8</mn></mfrac><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mn>10</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. Find common denominator (40): <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>d</mi></mrow><mn>40</mn></mfrac><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>d</mi></mrow><mn>40</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. This simplifies to <math><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mn>40</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, so <math><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>200</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use the formula Time = Distance / Speed and set up an equation based on the time difference.
